author: aharon
title: ₳GOV: Agreements Building Platform
description: Decentralized decision making requires wide discussions, but platforms that are used by DAOs members are not suitable for this purpose.

author: bartveld1
title: A gaming DAO, players in control!
description: The gamers of games decide if the games become a success or not but they are not part of the revenues and decision-making processes? Why?

author: karlgandhi360
title: DAOForge Easily Create cardanoDOA's
description: Due to the complexities of Plutus(Cardano's scripting language) creating DOA's on Cardano is a difficult and technical process.

author: adagov.org
title: ₳GOV: URL Conversations
description: What does a good governance user experience look like? Current DAO platforms are targeted toward bringing content INTO a closed platform.

author: shaelriley
title: MADAO: Mutual Aid DAO
description: The top-down organization of traditional mutual aid networks limits their accessibility and effectiveness.

author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: DAO Deployment Platform
description: There is a lack of frameworks and tools to create and manage a decentralized autonomous organizations in Cardano blockchain.

author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET: Sybil Defense DAO
description: Sybil-resistant anonymous authentication is a common challenge for DAOs however there are no open source solutions or services on Cardano.

author: lpanchot
title: DAO smart contract templetizaiton
description: There is no easy way to create, govern, and execute DAO protocols.

author: aljosa
title: A Cardano businesses focused DAO
description: There is no clear path to establish a business to operate a Cardano based project and launch a relevant crypto/blockchain business model.

author: kareemb
title: Decentralizied Farm to Table
description: Right now Farmers and Collectives are fragmented and too difficult for the average person who wants good healthy local food to navigate.

author: jeffrey.downard
title: Spaceship Earth DAO
description: We've only have one earth. We need to treat it with respect. How to use DAOs to support social and environmental sustainability?

author: jeffrey.downard
title: Cardano Climate DAO
description: How to create a Cardano DAO with a big impact on climate change?

author: wadalliance
title: wadaDAO
description: DAO tools on Cardano are early.  Customizable tooling for treasury management, voting, organizing, and multilateral agreements are lacking.

author: timbasurf
title: The DAO of Trailer Parks
description: Trailer owners can be evicted with minimal compensation when retiring park owners seek a fair exit. Global multi B$ issue harms rural poor.

author: rin9s
title: Decentralized Governance Alliance
description:
Decentralized Gov. is in its infancy and presents a fundamental issue for DAOs.
We can offer dGov resources & expertise to attract DAOs.

author: wadalliance
title: Wada Preserving Culture: NFT -> DAO
description: Digital services for Intellectual Property are not available to Indigenous Communities, excluding them from fair and legal representation.

author: danadak
title: Collab Tools for Community DAOs
description: Communities lack tools, helpful knowledge, and the  effective collaborative practices necessary to create & operate Community DAOs.

author: secretdecks
title: Enhance Automated Self Reporting
description: Self reporting is difficult albeit most important in distributed organisations. Current tools make it tedious to do correct self auditing.

author: didnkallaehawe
title: Bees Delivery DAO
description: Most delivery systems today in developing countries such as CMR are centralized and do not leverage advantages offered by the local context.

author: dcspark
title: Milkomeda DAO Hackathon
description: Many Cardano users don't realize they can launch their DAO on Milkomeda using mature tooling

author: secondlayer
title: Open-source Catalyst voting app
description: Catalyst Voting app is not open-source & can't be used by native asset issuers

author: mammoth
title: Woolly Mammoth de-extinction D₳O
description: The plans to de-extinct the mammoth will face numerous challenges and will require interdisciplinary expert input and public acceptance.

author: vinaydeva
title: KONMA DAO
description: Traditional forms of governance have many levels of management for the coordination & enforcement of procedures,thus slowing decision making

author: profd2004
title: Simple fund management DAO SDK
description: SDKs that make it easy for builders to easily build quality tools and solutions are still limited.

author: cardano4climate
title: Littlefish Foundation Kiva-like DAO
description: Limited TRUST in International Organizations, lack of transparency, and lack of involvement in fund allocation in SDG activities.

author: ben.mesnik
title: Mobilize NFT groups via DAO tooling
description: NFTs offer an exciting new way to structure governance and access, but they're restrained by limited functionality.

author: mlabs
title: MLabs DDAO
description: DApp development on Cardano involves several challenges for developers and community builders.

author: gonzalocamps
title: DAO Displays for Public Spaces
description: Public Spaces gather every stakeholder of society; but its information-displays have been sold to big advertisers, rejecting local contents.

author: heinz.gassner
title: EU-Compliant DAO Blueprint
description: DAOs are a logical consequence from introducing Smart Contracts. Many approaches are currently navigating through uncertain legal terrain

author: viktormux
title: TRANSPORT & LOGISITCS DAO
description: Small/Medium sized Transport & Logistic Companies will struggle to upgrade their managing systems to implement DLT and AI.

author: theada.dao
title: Creating Cardano DAO Infrastructure
description: DAOs need toolsets for organizing, voting, and treasury to enable autonomous operation that can be used by DAO members to direct policy.

author: mlemay
title: DAO addressing Digital Divide
description: Telecom infrastructures are large projects that need to involve population in their governance for community network initiatives.

author: nftdao
title: DAO Decentralized Communication
description: DAOs require good communication & collaboration tools but lack alternatives to centrally controlled (FANG) communication platforms.

author: quasar
title: DisWOCO
description: Catalyst and Cardano needs a Distributed Worker Cooperative

author: albert.feghaly
title: PanDAO: Focus on interoperability
description: There exists an urgent need for cross-chain governance standards, e.g. interacting with NFTs that live on decentralized storage systems.

author: dcspark
title: Smart contract upgradability
description: Currently smart contracts in Cardano have no standard design pattern for upgradability which is problematic for DAOs or dApps in-testing

author: dcspark
title: Basic Plutus Voting dApp
description: DAOs in Cardano right now have no way to do smart contract powered voting

author: gabrielaxel
title: DAOJob: The HR Tooling for DAOs
description: As the DAO space grows, so does the need for contributors. Current job boards have limited reach and aren't optimized for DAO operations.

author: wolstaeb
title: DAO Treasury Building Blocks
description: Raising and managing DAO funds in an accountable way is best done with smart contracts but that requires Plutus engineering expertise.

author: omidajorlou235
title: Decentral contract mechanism
description: Signe Contract for employees and employers in remote work is challengable and there is a lot of fraud for employees that work and don't paid

author: bolaji
title: DAOs for Creative communities
description: Creative communities in Africa are highly subjected to counterfeiting, inadequate financial services and lack of provenance of art.
